org.diirt.service

Class AbstractFileServiceProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.diirt.service.AbstractFileServiceProvider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ServiceProvider
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExecServiceProvider, JDBCServiceProvider, PVARPCServiceProvider

    public abstract class AbstractFileServiceProvider
extends Object
implements ServiceProvider
    A service provider that can create a service instance for each file in the configuration directory.

    If the configuration directory does not exist, it is created. If the path given is not a directory, an empty list is return and a warning message is logged. By default, the configuration directory will be located in $DIIRT_HOME/services/SERVICE_PROVIDER_NAME.

    This class provides the crawling of the configuration directory and the logging of both service creation and errors.

    Author:
    carcassi

      Creates a new provider that looks for configuration files in the given directory.

    • Method Detail

      • getDefaultConfigurationDirectory

        public File getDefaultConfigurationDirectory()
        The default location for the configuration. By default, it is $DIIRT_HOME/services/SERVICE_PROVIDER_NAME.
        Returns:
        the configuration location

      • createService

        public abstract Service createService(File file)
                               throws Exception
        Creates a service from the given file.

        Implementors of this method need not to care about logging and service registration.

        Parameters:
        file - a file in the configuration directory
        Returns:
        the new service or null if no service corresponds to the file
        Throws:
        Exception - if there is a problem creating the service from the file

      • additionalServices

        public Collection<Service> additionalServices()
        Creates additional services that are not read from files. This can be useful in case the service provider has additional services that are not user defined through configuration files.

        Implementors need not to care about logging and service registration.

        Returns:
        a collection of services

      • createServices

        public final Collection<Service> createServices()
        Creates all the service instances by crawling the configuration directory, creating a service for each file found, and creating the additional services.

        Given that this method provides the error handling and logging, it is declared final so that subclasses cannot accidently remove it.

        Specified by:
        createServices in interface ServiceProvider
        Returns:
        the new service instances
